citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The semi-annual report to the Institutional Official dated 12/11/24 that was prepared by the IACUC for the June 2024
program review and facility inspection was reviewed. The semi-annual report was signed by the members of the IACUC
and stated that there were no deficiencies identified in the program review or the facility inspection. However, the minutes
for the convened IACUC meeting held on 6/4/24 when the semi-annual reviews were conducted/performed stated that the
IACUC had identified one deficiency during the program review and had identified two deficiencies during the facility
inspection.
Per this Section, one of the functions of the IACUC is to prepare semi-annual reports to the Institutional Official following
the Committee’s review of the animal use program and the inspection of the animal facilities. The content of these semi-
annual reports should accurately describe the nature and extent of the research facility’s adherence with the AWA
Regulations for the program and animal facilities to provide the Institutional Official with accurate information on the status
of all aspects of the research facility.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Protocol 2024-2025 that was reviewed and approved by the IACUC in June 2024 does not accurately describe the
procedures that are performed on the animals. The IACUC approved protocol includes a procedure that has not been
conducted in many years (breeding); included using male animals that have not been used on this protocol for many
years; and the number of animals used per study group was not described.
Per this Section, proposals to conduct an activity involving animals must contain a complete description of the proposed
use of the animals that accurately describes the procedures that will be performed on the animals so the IACUC can
determine during its review that all components of the animal use proposal are in accordance with the requirements as
outlined in this subchapter of the AWA. The IACUC needs to address this item. Correct by 7/11/25.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c)(3)  Repeat
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The semi-annual report to the Institutional Official dated 12/11/24 that was prepared by the IACUC for the June 2024 
program review and facility inspection was reviewed. The semi-annual report was signed by the members of the IACUC 
and stated that there were no deficiencies identified in the program review or the facility inspection. However, the minutes 
for the convened IACUC meeting held on 6/4/24 when the semi-annual reviews were conducted/performed stated that the 
IACUC had identified one deficiency during the program review and had identified two deficiencies during the facility 
inspection.  
 
Per this Section, one of the functions of the IACUC is to prepare semi-annual reports to the Institutional Official following 
the Committee’s review of the animal use program and the inspection of the animal facilities. The content of these semi-
annual reports should accurately describe the nature and extent of the research facility’s adherence with the AWA 
Regulations for the program and animal facilities to provide the Institutional Official with accurate information on the status 
of all aspects of the research facility. 
2.31(e)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
Protocol 2024-2025 that was reviewed and approved by the IACUC in June 2024 does not accurately describe the 
procedures that are performed on the animals. The IACUC approved protocol includes a procedure that has not been 
conducted in many years (breeding); included using male animals that have not been used on this protocol for many 
years; and the number of animals used per study group was not described.  
 
Per this Section, proposals to conduct an activity involving animals must contain a complete description of the proposed 
use of the animals that accurately describes the procedures that will be performed on the animals so the IACUC can 
determine during its review that all components of the animal use proposal are in accordance with the requirements as 
outlined in this subchapter of the AWA. The IACUC needs to address this item. Correct by 7/11/25. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.

n
